Sentencas: Recent studies have demonstrated the possibility of stabilizing the cubic or tetragonal perovskite phases in the SrCoO3-delta system at room temperature by partially replacing Co atoms with small amounts of highly charged cations like Ti4+ in SrCo0.95Ti0.05O3-delta.
Titulo: Reducing the Cobalt Content in SrCo0.95Ti0.05O3-δ-Based Perovskites to Produce Cleaner Cathodes for IT-SOFCs

Sentencas: This material gives extraordinary performances as a cathode for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) at intermediate temperatures (800-850 degrees C).
Titulo: Reducing the Cobalt Content in SrCo0.95Ti0.05O3-δ-Based Perovskites to Produce Cleaner Cathodes for IT-SOFCs

Sentencas: In this work, we have tried to still improve this cathode in a cleaner and low-priced material by reducing its Co content, since Co is a high-cost and toxic element, additionally reducing its thermal expansion coefficient (TEC), to make it more mechanically compatible with the rest of the components of a SOFC.
Titulo: Reducing the Cobalt Content in SrCo0.95Ti0.05O3-δ-Based Perovskites to Produce Cleaner Cathodes for IT-SOFCs

Sentencas: SrCo0.50Fe0.45Ti0.05O3-delta perovskite has been obtained by the citrate method, introducing 45% of Fe in the Co and Ti positions.
Titulo: Reducing the Cobalt Content in SrCo0.95Ti0.05O3-δ-Based Perovskites to Produce Cleaner Cathodes for IT-SOFCs

Sentencas: Its crystalline structure has been studied by X-ray diffraction (XRD) and neutron powder diffraction (NPD) and has been correlated with mechanical and electrical properties.
Titulo: Reducing the Cobalt Content in SrCo0.95Ti0.05O3-δ-Based Perovskites to Produce Cleaner Cathodes for IT-SOFCs

Sentencas: A chemical compatibility study between SrCo0.50Fe0.45Ti0.05O3-delta and the electrolyte La0.8Sr0.2Ga0.83Mg0.17O3-delta (LSGM) revealed that both materials do not interact at high temperatures.
Titulo: Reducing the Cobalt Content in SrCo0.95Ti0.05O3-δ-Based Perovskites to Produce Cleaner Cathodes for IT-SOFCs

Sentencas: TEC measurements show a linear expansion over the entire temperature range.
Titulo: Reducing the Cobalt Content in SrCo0.95Ti0.05O3-δ-Based Perovskites to Produce Cleaner Cathodes for IT-SOFCs

Sentencas: Finally, the perovskite showed good electrical conductivity and an encouraging power density value of 667 mW/cm2 at 850 degrees C, which indicate that this material is a promising cathode for SOFCs at intermediate temperatures.
Titulo: Reducing the Cobalt Content in SrCo0.95Ti0.05O3-δ-Based Perovskites to Produce Cleaner Cathodes for IT-SOFCs
